channel.title: Html5 pics
channel.description:
So I logged on to the beta today... god it took for freaking forever at that.
[IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/23ly6mq.png[/img]
that was the end result on "low"
It pretty much boils down to what I thought...that it was a conspiracy to make you buy better equipment. SO I guess I won't be playing RS when that happens.

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:66, topic:516946”][quote author=3lv3n snip3r link=topic=635207.msg4336986#msg4336986 date=1374530536]
I really like the new login music. It’s the old one, but revamped with actual instruments.
[/quote]Yeah, there are a few songs they redid with an actual orchestra, hopefully they end up doing a lot more like that.

Listen to Newbie Melody. :)[/quote]
It sound like something from Lord of the Rings because it’s with an actual orchestra lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

played it

they pushed back the html 5 release, thats all I wanted to see

game as a whole feels really sloppy though

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

Well, the update rolls out in a little over a day. I can run the HTML fine with a little lag, and the game looks pretty good.

The NIS on the other hand, I don’t really like. I guess I can get used to it with time but the interfaces aren’t appealing to me, and everything is so hard to find, but I do like being able to move them around and re-size them.

All in all I think everything still needs a ton of work and isn’t ready for the update, but we will see how this plays out.

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:54, topic:516946”]For Christs sake THE HTML5 CLIENT WILL STAY IN BETA:

"With RuneScape 3 under a week away, we’ve updated the New Interface System beta so you can get a preview of the near-final version that will be replacing the existing one on July 22nd. From your feedback, we’ve made further improvements to the New Interface System, most notably, there’s a super-slim mode, as well as some handy modifications to the bank interface. Check out the changelist here.

As mentioned when we announced the RuneScape 3 release date, we’ve decided to keep the HTML5 game client in beta for the coming months. RS3 continues full steam ahead for launch on 22nd July, with the epic Battle of Lumbridge content, New Interface System, new audio system & music, upgraded camera and seasonal hiscores. The HTML5 beta client will remain available to try out, but we’ll be recommending most players stick with the existing Java version"
Never once did I say that RS3 was doing to stay in beta.[/quote]
Alright, sorry I don’t read up on RuneScape’s news and updates constantly. No need to flip a nut.

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics

item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“4x4Chevrolet, post:48, topic:516946”]This is with the graphics turned all the way down:

My head is shiny lol, but I’m very pleased by it. I love the interfaces and graphics, I’m just probably going to be sticking to the Java client until the official HTML5 client release, the beta version has just a little more lag than I care to deal with while playing…

Only bug I see is that my name never loaded up.[/quote]once the release comes out it will be the same as the beta :o

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Lin:

It’s sad because all of their shaders produce such pretty graphics, but they’re ruined with the shitty grass models and lack of object-terrain blending/ambient occlusion.

They do have terrain blending. They’ve had it since '08. They do lack AO still, but they are moving into more and more HDR effects which is looking nice.

PS: Stop complaining haha. They are using OpenGL ES 2.0 for everything, plus all of the code that interacts with WebGL is in JavaScript. It’s running FANTASTICALLY for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Logged in for the first time on the html5 client. All I can say is that I’ll definitely become more active just so I can look at the graphics. Works like a charm, and is so appealing to the eye.

Read full topic

item.title: Html5 pics
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

I got accepted to the beta today and decided to play it. It was up and I was logged in in about 5 minutes. Everything was loaded up within 2 minutes. I’d play it longer but it used up a lot of my RAM. My RAM usage is usually around 30% doing normal stuff on my computer, and when I started playing the client, it shot up to 90%. But I’m only using a laptop with 1 RAM stick with only 4gb. I might get another stick because my computer has two slots for RAM.

Read full topic
